movies.title: The Canal
movies.plot: Film archivist David (Rupert Evans) has been having a rough time lately, as he suspects that his wife Alice (Hannah Hoekstra) has been cheating on him with Alex (Carl Shaaban), one of her work clients. This stress is compounded when David's work partner Claire (Antonia Campbell-Hughes) gives him a reel of to-be-archived footage that shows that his house was the setting for a brutal murder in 1902. Becoming progressively more unsettled and unhinged, David begins to believe that a spectral presence is in his house and ends up following his wife to a nearby canal, where he discovers that she is indeed having an affair with Alex. When Alice goes missing shortly afterwards, David contacts the police- only to become the prime suspect in her disappearance. As the police grow more convinced that David has murdered his wife, he struggles to find proof of his growing suspicion that something otherworldly was instead responsible.
movies.simplePlot: A depressed and stressed film archivist finds his sanity crumbling after he is given an old 16mm film reel with footage from a horrific murder that occurred in the early 1900's.

biography.bio: Having graduated from Webber Douglas Academy of Dramatic Art, Rupert Evans started his career working mainly in television. Notably in British costume dramas such as 'Sons & Lovers' starring Sarah Lancashire and Hugo Speer, North and South, 'Crime and Punishment' and 'Fingersmith' with Imelda Staunton and Charles Dance. Added to that he has played major roles in TV series; including Rockface, Paradise Heights and 'A Midsummer Nights Dream'. 2006 was when he starred in his first studio movie, 'Hellboy', directed by 'Guillermo Del Toro', starring Selma Blair, John Hurt and Ron Perlman. Since then his focus has moved to theatre and independent film. In 2007 he starred in the indie film Arritmia, released in Europe, with Derek Jacobi and Natalia Verbeke playing two roles. In the theatre he's been seen as 'Romeo' and 'The Dauphin' in 'King John' at The Royal Shakespeare Company; and in the London, at The Donmar Warehouse Theatre, he played 'Valentin' in 'Kiss Of The Spider Woman'. Other theatre credits include 'Breathing Corpses' at The Royal Court Theatre and 'Sweet Panic' again in London's West End. Before his present film, Agora, he recently completed filming The Palace, a new mini series for TV in the UK, playing the title role of King of England.
biography.name: Rupert Evans

biography.bio: Antonia Campbell-Hughes was born in 1982 in Northern Ireland. She is an actress and writer, known for Albert Nobbs (2011), The Canal (2014) and 3096 Jours (2013).
biography.name: Antonia Campbell-Hughes

biography.bio: Hannah Hoekstra is a very talented actress. In 2012 she received a Gouden Kalf for her role in Hemel. She appeared on screen in the film APP and the television series Volgens Robert. In Ireland she appeared the film The Canalin 2013. Hannah has been engaged with the National Theatre since the season of 2013-2014. She is featured in several plays such as De Storm and As You Like It. This year she will be playing in the marathon performance Genesis. Hannah stars in a leading role in the film De Helleveeg, based on a novel by A.F.T.H van der Heijden. This movie is out in cinemas since the beginning of 2016.
biography.name: Hannah Hoekstra

biography.bio: Kelly Byrne is an Irish actress making waves internationally for her role in "The Canal" by award winning director Ivan Kavanagh. She has also appeared in Donal Foreman's "Out of Here" and most recently in Darren Thornton's "A Date for Mad Mary". In 2010 Kelly Studied at The Gaeity School of Acting. In 2011 she was invited by director Kirsten Sheridan into the Actors Studio at Bow Street (Formerly The Factory). Subsequently in 2013-2014 she trained at Bow Street on The Full time Screen Acting Programme course under director's Shimmy Marcus, Kirsten Sheridan, John Carney, Cathy Brady, Lance Daly, John Carney and casting director Maureen Hughes.
biography.name: Kelly Byrne

biography.bio: Steve Oram was born on August 25, 1973 in Melton Mowbray, Leicestershire, England. He is an actor and writer, known for Sightseers (2012), The World's End (2013) and The Canal (2014).
biography.name: Steve Oram

biography.bio: Calum Heath is an actor, known for The Canal (2014), Little Bear (2015) and The Welfare of Tomás Ó Hallissy (2016).
biography.name: Calum Heath

biography.bio: Anneke Blok was born in 1960 in Rheden, Gelderland, Netherlands. She is an actress, known for Love Is All (2007), Winter in Wartime (2008) and Zus & zo (2001).
biography.name: Anneke Blok

biography.bio: Paddy Curran is an actor, known for The Departed (2006), The Canal (2014) and Grand Theft Auto IV: The Ballad of Gay Tony (2009).
biography.name: Paddy Curran

biography.bio: Carl Shaaban is an actor and producer, known for The Canal (2014), The Light of Day (2014) and 1,000 Times Good Night (2013).
biography.name: Carl Shaaban

biography.bio: Alicja Ayres is an actor, known for The Canal (2014), I Used to Live Here (2014) and Monged (2015).
biography.name: Alicja Ayres

biography.bio: Nick Devlin is an actor, known for The Canal (2014), Dawn of the Dragonslayer (2011) and El cuaderno de Sara (2017).
biography.name: Nick Devlin

biography.bio: Serena Brabazon is known for her work on Albert Nobbs (2011), The Canal (2014) and The Chronoscope (2009).
biography.name: Serena Brabazon

biography.bio: Myles Horgan is an actor and writer, known for Le vent se lève (2006), The Canal (2014) and Strength and Honour (2007).
biography.name: Myles Horgan

biography.bio: Conor Horgan first trained as a photographer before moving into directing TV commercials and music promos. His first feature film is One Hundred Mornings, which received its world premiere at the Slamdance Film Festival in 2010, winning the Special Mention Award. His first short film, The Last Time, starring Linda Bassett (East is East), received a nationwide cinema release in Ireland and was the recipient of seven awards around the world, including the UIP Director Award and Best Irish Short at The Cork Film Festival. His first feature documentary, The Queen of Ireland, was released throughout Ireland in October 2015. He lives in Dublin, Ireland.
biography.name: Conor Horgan

biography.bio: Natalie Radmall-Quirke is an actress, known for The Canal (2014), Davin (2014) and Striking Out (2017).
biography.name: Natalie Radmall-Quirke

titlesAwards.titleAwardOutcome: Won Bingham Ray New Talent Award
